definition: to have a fluent command of (idiom)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Leverage computer and Internet tools to make one's work more efficient.
sentences.chinese: 對計算機及因特網的技能運用自如，提高工作效率。

sentences.english: I admire her good command of the French language.
sentences.chinese: 我非常羨慕她對法語運用自如。

sentences.english: Special 5 interior pockets of wide buttom designed, vast capacity, grasp and apply skillfully.
sentences.chinese: 與衆不同的五層寬底內頁設計，超大容量，運用自如。

sentences.english: Heavily armoured soldiers, effective in the use of the hand gun and one handed axe.
sentences.chinese: 威爾士手炮兵身穿重甲，對手炮和戰斧都運用自如。

sentences.english: Youll feel in command of your English.
sentences.chinese: 你會覺得你的英語運用自如。

sentences.english: Very few of us can use both of our hands equally well.
sentences.chinese: 我們當中很少有人能雙手都運用自如。

sentences.english: GongDing was able to use freely many styles of poets and the art characters were distinct.
sentences.chinese: 公鼐對多種詩歌體裁運用自如，藝術特點鮮明。

definition: properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
to understand tacitly (idiom)/to know intuitively/to understand thoroughly
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
